Summary: it looked like a cluster of balloons that had gotten away, but was more stable in flight
trends: There have been no other sightings in Bay Head
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting Detailsi was sitting on the beach, looking east over the atlantic ocean as the sun was setting behind me. looking south, i noticed a craft moving north at a pretty decent speed - say 60 m.p.h, based on the how long it takes me to drive the distance i saw it fly. coast guard helicopters and small planes dragging advertisements fly up and down the coast pretty frequently and i always stop and watch as they fly by - just for fun. when i first saw the craft i figured it was a helicopter, but as it got closer, i started thinking it was a cluster of balloons that had gotten away. but then i realized that it wasn't spinning or moving up or down as balloons normally do in flight. it was flying straight without any noticeable change in speed or elevation. the part of it hanging down ( which i thought would be strings ) was thicker than string would be and was pointing directly downward, and not back toward the south like i would have expected if the balloons were being pushed by the wind. it didn't make any noticeable noise. there was a bit of wind, but not enough to drown out the voices of the kids playing about 50 yards down-wind from me. also, as far as witnesses go: there were at least 20-30 people on the beach that i could see and i watched as the craft flew past the boardwalk in point pleasant. and lastly, there was a couple walking north on the beach about 30 yards from me when it flew by. they stopped to watch it too, and afterward they asked if i knew what that was. i said, "no, and i won't say anything, if you don't." we laughed, and then said to each other, "no, really, what was that?" sorry i didn't have a camera or anything to take pictures. i bet someone in point pleasant did though, so i'm going to check flickr and youtube in a couple days for a post.
